title: MultiConnect Timestamp (NaiveDateTime, PrimitiveDateTime, OffsetDateTime) not working.
body:
<!--
If you want to report a bug, we added some points below which help us track down the problem faster.
-->

## Setup

Simple small program using the MultiConnect derive with the following schema and table.
```rust
pub mod schema {
    table! {
        posts (id) {
            id -> Integer,
            title -> Varchar,
            body -> Text,
            updated -> Timestamp,
        }
    }
}

pub mod models {
    use chrono::NaiveDateTime;

    use crate::schema::posts;
    #[derive(Queryable, Insertable)]
    pub struct Post {
        pub id: i32,
        pub title: String,
        pub body: String,
        pub updated: NaiveDateTime,
    }
}
```

### Versions

- **Rust:** rustc 1.73.0-nightly (180dffba1 2023-08-14)
- **Diesel:** master branch (c99ebda62395a092e059d6ca494861afa559028b)
- **Database:** MultiConnection (sqlite, postgresql, mysql)
- **Operating System:** Linux

### Feature Flags

- **diesel:** "chrono", "r2d2"

## Problem Description
When trying to use `Timestamp` via `NaiveDateTime` using the `MultiConnection` it reports there is no `ToSql`, and probably it will also complain there is no `FromSql`, but i haven't gotten that far yet.

### What are you trying to accomplish?
Using the `MultiConnection` derive feature using a single schema/table layout.

### What is the expected output?
No errors, and a way to be working with at least `NaiveDateTime`.

### What is the actual output?
Compile error.

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `NaiveDateTime: ToSql<diesel::sql_types::Timestamp, multi_connection_impl::backend::MultiBackend>` is not satisfied
    --> src/main.rs:245:26
     |
245  |                 .execute(conn).expect("Error during inserting user");
     |                  ------- ^^^^ the trait `ToSql<diesel::sql_types::Timestamp, multi_connection_impl::backend::MultiBackend>` is not implemented for `NaiveDateTime`
     |                  |
     |                  required by a bound introduced by this call
     |
     = help: the following other types implement trait `ToSql<A, DB>`:
               <NaiveDateTime as ToSql<diesel::sql_types::Timestamp, Mysql>>
               <NaiveDateTime as ToSql<diesel::sql_types::Timestamp, Pg>>
               <NaiveDateTime as ToSql<diesel::sql_types::Timestamp, Sqlite>>
               <NaiveDateTime as ToSql<diesel::sql_types::Nullable<diesel::sql_types::Timestamp>, __DB>>
               <NaiveDateTime as ToSql<diesel::sql_types::Nullable<Datetime>, __DB>>
               <NaiveDateTime as ToSql<diesel::sql_types::Nullable<diesel::sql_types::Timestamptz>, __DB>>
               <NaiveDateTime as ToSql<Datetime, Mysql>>
               <NaiveDateTime as ToSql<diesel::sql_types::Timestamptz, Pg>>
               <NaiveDateTime as ToSql<TimestamptzSqlite, Sqlite>>
     = note: required for `diesel::expression::bound::Bound<diesel::sql_types::Timestamp, NaiveDateTime>` to implement `QueryFragment<multi_connection_impl::backend::MultiBackend>`
     = note: 1 redundant requirement hidden
     = note: required for `ColumnInsertValue<schema::posts::columns::updated, diesel::expression::bound::Bound<diesel::sql_types::Timestamp, NaiveDateTime>>` to implement `QueryFragment<multi_connection_impl::backend::MultiBackend>`
     = note: required for `ColumnInsertValue<schema::posts::columns::updated, diesel::expression::bound::Bound<diesel::sql_types::Timestamp, NaiveDateTime>>` to implement `InsertValues<schema::posts::table, multi_connection_impl::backend::MultiBackend>`
     = note: 3 redundant requirements hidden
     = note: required for `InsertStatement<table, ValuesClause<(ColumnInsertValue<title, Bound<Text, String>>, ColumnInsertValue<body, Bound<Text, String>>, ColumnInsertValue<published, Bound<Bool, bool>>, ColumnInsertValue<updated, Bound<Timestamp, NaiveDateTime>>), table>>` to implement `QueryFragment<multi_connection_impl::backend::MultiBackend>`
     = note: the full type name has been written to '/home/mathijs/rust/dieselmulticrate/target/debug/deps/dieselmulticrate-ddcbaeaecb4c0ddd.long-type-901884936185368146.txt'
     = note: required for `InsertStatement<table, ValuesClause<(ColumnInsertValue<title, Bound<Text, String>>, ColumnInsertValue<body, Bound<Text, String>>, ColumnInsertValue<published, Bound<Bool, bool>>, ColumnInsertValue<updated, Bound<Timestamp, NaiveDateTime>>), table>>` to implement `ExecuteDsl<InferConnection, multi_connection_impl::backend::MultiBackend>`
     = note: the full type name has been written to '/home/mathijs/rust/dieselmulticrate/target/debug/deps/dieselmulticrate-ddcbaeaecb4c0ddd.long-type-901884936185368146.txt'
note: required by a bound in `diesel::RunQueryDsl::execute`
    --> /home/mathijs/rust/diesel/diesel/src/query_dsl/mod.rs:1432:15
     |
1429 |     fn execute(self, conn: &mut Conn) -> QueryResult<usize>
     |        ------- required by a bound in this associated function
...
1432 |         Self: methods::ExecuteDsl<Conn>,
     | 
```

### Are you seeing any additional errors?
No (not  yet)

### Steps to reproduce

Use the schema/table layout from above.
And this is a create table for Postgresql as an example.
```sql
CREATE TABLE posts (
  id            INTEGER   NOT NULL PRIMARY KEY,
  title         TEXT      NOT NULL,
  body          TEXT      NOT NULL,
  updated       TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);
```

<!--
Please include as much of your codebase as needed to reproduce the error.  If the relevant files are large, please consider linking to a public repository or a [Gist](https://gist.github.com/). This includes normally the following parts:

* The exact code where your hit the problem
* Relevant parts your schema, so any `table!` macro calls required for
* Any other type definitions involved in the code, which produces your problem
-->

## Checklist

- [x] I have already looked over the [issue tracker](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/issues) and the [discussion forum](https://github.com/diesel-rs/diesel/discussions) for similar possible closed issues.
<!--
If you are unsure if your issue is a duplicate of an existing issue please link the issue in question here
--> 
- [x] This issue can be reproduced on Rust's stable channel. (Your issue will be
  closed if this is not the case)
- [x] This issue can be reproduced without requiring a third party crate

<!--
Thank you for your submission!  You're helping make Diesel more robust ðŸŽ‰

We'll try to respond as quickly as possible.
-->
